name: QuantEcon Lectures
description: High-quality lecture series on quantitative economic modeling, computational tools, and economics using Python/Julia.

name: Python for Econometrics
description: Comprehensive introductory notes covering fundamentals, core libraries, and applied econometrics in Python.

name: Coding for Economists
description: Practical guidance on applying Python to contemporary econometric research and data workflows.

name: The Missing Semester of Your CS Education
description: MIT course covering developer essentials: command-line tools, version control, debugging, and more.

name: Beyond Jupyter
description: Software design principles for ML: modularity, abstraction, and reproducibility beyond ad hoc Jupyter workflows.

name: Machine Learning Specialization
description: Beginner-friendly 3-course series by Andrew Ng covering core ML methods: regression, classification, clustering, trees, neural networks.

name: Deep Learning Specialization
description: Advanced neural network training covering CNNs, RNNs, and practical deep learning with TensorFlow.

name: Introduction to Statistical Learning
description: Classic textbook on statistical learning methods with applications in R and Python. Free online.

name: Mostly Harmless Econometrics
description: Essential guide to empirical methods in economics, covering regression, IV, panel data, and more.

name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
description: Modern introduction to causal inference methods (DiD, IV, RDD, Synthetic Control, ML-based) with Python code examples.

name: The Effect: An Introduction to Research Design
description: Modern causal inference textbook covering identification, DAGs, and research design strategies.

name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
description: Scott Cunningham's guide to causal inference with code examples in Stata, R, and Python.

name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments
description: Comprehensive guide to A/B testing and experimentation from Microsoft researchers.

name: Experimentation Platform Guide
description: Practical guide to building experimentation platforms and running A/B tests at scale.

name: Convex Optimization
description: Boyd and Vandenberghe's classic textbook on convex optimization theory and algorithms. Free online.

name: Numerical Optimization
description: Nocedal and Wright's comprehensive guide to numerical optimization methods.

name: Algorithms for Optimization
description: Modern textbook covering optimization algorithms with Julia code examples. Free PDF available.

name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice
description: Hyndman and Athanasopoulos's comprehensive guide to time series forecasting with R. Free online.

name: Time Series Analysis and Its Applications
description: Shumway and Stoffer's textbook on time series methods with R examples.

name: Applied Time Series Econometrics
description: LÃ¼tkepohl's guide to VAR models, cointegration, and structural time series analysis.

name: Structural Estimation in Economics
description: Overview of structural estimation methods including MLE, GMM, and simulation-based estimation.

name: Discrete Choice Methods with Simulation
description: Kenneth Train's comprehensive guide to discrete choice modeling. Free PDF available.

name: Industrial Organization: A Structural Approach
description: Berry and Reiss's chapter on structural IO methods including demand estimation and entry models.

name: Auction Theory
description: Vijay Krishna's comprehensive textbook on auction theory covering single-item and multi-item auctions, mechanism design, and optimal auctions.

name: Microeconomic Theory
description: Mas-Colell, Whinston, and Green's classic graduate microeconomics textbook covering consumer theory, producer theory, and game theory.

name: Game Theory
description: Fudenberg and Tirole's rigorous treatment of game theory including strategic form games, extensive form games, and repeated games.
